results.title: Flowering plants and their parts
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Relates the roots, stems and leaves of plants to plant growth and reproduction. Illustrates the ability of plants to adapt to their environment.

results.title: Casey draws the line.
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Beacon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
A dispute between two children over property boundaries gets out of hand when they cannot come to an agreement over the shared care of a rabbit. Lines are drawn and fences are erected. The position seems untenable until the unfortunate death of the rabbit. Raises issues about the attitudes and values attached to property and ownership.

results.title: Lisa makes the headlines
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
Lisa’s newspaper isn’t selling very well. When Ida, one of her friends is robbed, Lisa thinks she is onto a scoop. However she comes to realise that she has to get her facts straight before she can write a good story. From the television series.

results.title: Cookie goes to hospital
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
The kids of DeGrassi Street find themselves involved in another adventure when Cookie suddenly takes ill during a club meeting and is sent to hospital to have her appendix removed. Cookie is apprehensive of her first visit to hospital and asks her friends to get her doll from the club house. Provides an insight into hospital routines and operational procedures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time

results.title: Outer planets
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Uses special effects to create the impression of what is known of the outer planets - Jupitor, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto. Explains why life cannot be sustained on these planets. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Moon
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Stanton Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides information about the structural characteristics of the Moon and its effect on our planet. Shows that the moon is a satellite of the Earth, that its gravity is different to that of Earth, how it affects the Earth’s tides and why its surface is pitted with craters. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Earth
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Media Four Productions and Stanton Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides information about the planet Earth - how its distance from the sun is the optimum distance for sustaining life, the notions of rotation and gravitational pull, the earth’s structure and the movement of the Earth’s crust, i.e., tectonic plates.
